label: Web Development
description: Skills related to building and maintaining websites.

items.label: HTML
items.description: HyperText Markup Language, used for creating the structure of web pages.

items.label: CSS
items.description: Cascading Style Sheets, used for styling the presentation and layout of web pages.

items.label: JavaScript
items.description: A versatile scripting language used for adding interactivity and dynamic elements to web pages.

items.label: PHP
items.description: A server-side scripting language used for web development and building dynamic websites.

items.label: Python
items.description: A high-level programming language often used for web development and building web applications.

items.label: Ruby
items.description: A dynamic, object-oriented programming language commonly used in web development.

items.label: Java
items.description: A widely-used object-oriented programming language for building cross-platform web applications.

items.label: Node.js
items.description: A JavaScript runtime environment that allows executing server-side JavaScript code.

items.label: Express.js
items.description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework, ideal for building APIs.

items.label: React
items.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications.

items.label: Angular
items.description: A TypeScript-based web application framework for building dynamic, single-page applications.

items.label: Vue.js
items.description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces, suitable for single-page applications.

items.label: Laravel
items.description: A PHP web framework for building web applications following the MVC architectural pattern.

items.label: Django
items.description: A high-level Python web framework for rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

items.label: Ruby on Rails
items.description: A web application framework written in Ruby, designed for simplicity and productivity.

items.label: WordPress
items.description: A popular content management system (CMS) for creating and managing websites and blogs.

items.label: Shopify
items.description: A popular content management system (CMS) for creating and managing e-commerce websites.

items.label: GraphQL
items.description: A query language for APIs, often used to fetch data from servers to clients in a more efficient way.

items.label: MongoDB
items.description: A popular NoSQL database used for storing and retrieving data in web applications.

items.label: MySQL
items.description: An open-source relational database management system, commonly used in web development.

items.label: Git
items.description: A distributed version control system used to manage and track changes in code repositories.

items.label: Webpack
items.description: A module bundler for JavaScript applications, commonly used with modern web development workflows.

items.label: Sass/SCSS
items.description: Extensions of CSS that provide additional features like variables and nested rules for easier styling.

items.label: Bootstrap
items.description: A popular CSS framework for building responsive and visually appealing web interfaces.

items.label: jQuery
items.description: A fast and lightweight JavaScript library for simplifying interactions with HTML documents.

items.label: RESTful APIs
items.description: Design and implementation of APIs that follow the principles of Representational State Transfer.

items.label: JSON
items.description: A lightweight data-interchange format often used for data transmission between a server and a web application.

items.label: XML
items.description: Another data-interchange format used for storing and transporting data between different systems.

items.label: HTTP/HTTPS
items.description: Understanding of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol and its secure version used for web communication.

items.label: Cross-Browser Compatibility
items.description: Ensuring web applications work well on different web browsers and versions.

items.label: Responsive Web Design
items.description: Designing and developing websites to provide optimal user experience on various devices and screen sizes.

label: Multimedia
description: Skills related to creating and editing multimedia content.

items.label: Adobe Photoshop
items.description: A powerful image editing software used for graphic design and photo manipulation.

items.label: Adobe Illustrator
items.description: A vector graphics editor used for creating illustrations, logos, and icons.

items.label: Adobe Premiere Pro
items.description: A video editing software used for professional video production.

items.label: Final Cut Pro
items.description: Apple's video editing software designed for macOS users.

items.label: 3D Modeling
items.description: The process of creating three-dimensional models of objects using specialized software.

items.label: Video Editing
items.description: The process of manipulating and rearranging video clips to create a final video production.

items.label: Motion Graphics
items.description: The art of using animation and visual effects to create the illusion of motion in multimedia projects.

items.label: Adobe After Effects
items.description: A digital visual effects, motion graphics, and compositing application used in post-production.

items.label: Audio Editing
items.description: The process of manipulating and enhancing audio recordings for various multimedia projects.

items.label: Sound Design
items.description: The creation and manipulation of audio elements to enhance the overall auditory experience of multimedia projects.

items.label: Blender
items.description: An open-source 3D computer graphics software used for creating animated films, visual effects, and games.

items.label: UI/UX Design
items.description: The process of enhancing user satisfaction by improving the usability, accessibility, and overall interaction with digital products.

items.label: Web Designer
items.description: A professional who designs and creates the visual elements and user interfaces for websites.
